pageProps.content:
![Anmyeondo Island (ÏïàÎ©¥ÎèÑ)](/2022-07-28-1658975944792/2426575_image2_1.webp) ## Overview > Located 30 km away from Taean, Anmyeondo Island is the sixth largest island in Korea, where a 200-meter bridge constructed in 1970 connects the island with Taean-gun. The peninsula connected to Nammyeon was isolated during the Joseon Dynasty by cutting off access between Changgi-ri in Anmyeon-eup and Shinon-ri in Nammyeon for the convenience of tax transportation. The island's coast is lined with some 14 beaches as well as abundant pine trees, which are symbols of Anmyeon-eup. The island also owns Anmyeondo Natural Forest, along with the Mogamju Forest (Natural Monument No. 138). ## Intro | | | | - | - | |infocenter:|‚Ä¢ 1330 Travel Hotline: +82-2-1330
(Korean, English, Japanese, Chinese)
‚Ä¢ For more info: +82-41-673-3081| ## Detail Image ![/2022-07-28-1658975944792/1894300_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-28-1658975944792/1894300_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-28-1658975944792/2426560_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-28-1658975944792/2426560_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-28-1658975944792/2426561_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-28-1658975944792/2426561_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-28-1658975944792/2426564_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-28-1658975944792/2426564_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-28-1658975944792/2426570_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-28-1658975944792/2426570_image2_1.webp) ## Contact - [‚òéÔ∏è+82-41-673-3081](tel:+82416733081) - [üè†taean.go.kr](http://taean.go.kr/tour.do) ```googleMap latitude: 36.5205057910 longitude: 126.3445458886 title: 149, Jangteo-ro, Taean-gun, Chungcheongnam-do ``` ## Directions [Bus]
From Seoul Central City Terminal, take an intercity bus to Anmyeondo Island.

data.description: Located 30 km away from Taean, Anmyeondo Island is the sixth largest island in Korea, where a 200-meter bridge constructed in 1970 connects the island with Taean-gun. The peninsula connected to Nammyeon was isolated during the Joseon Dynasty by cutting off access between Changgi-ri in Anmyeon-eup and Shinon-ri in Nammyeon for the convenience of tax transportation. The island's coast is lined with some 14 beaches as well as abundant pine trees, which are symbols of Anmyeon-eup. The island also owns Anmyeondo Natural Forest, along with the Mogamju Forest (Natural Monument No. 138).
